body.p: Most of the respondents to the 2005 Exposure Draft supported its proposal on accounting for changes to the acquirer’s own deferred taxes in conjunction with a business combination. But some disagreed; they said that an acquirer factors its expected tax synergies into the price it is willing to pay for the acquiree, and therefore those tax synergies constitute goodwill. Those respondents were concerned about the potential for double‑counting the synergies once in the consideration and a second time by separately recognising the changes in the acquirer’s income taxes.
